theoryTitle: Gin's Survival and Return to the Grand Line
theoryText: For over 20 years, fans theorized about whether Gin survived the MH5 poisoning and what happened to him after the Baratie Arc. Some fans believed he died from the poison, while others theorized he survived and would return someday. Fans speculated he might reappear as various mysterious characters including Admiral Ryokugyu, Killer (Eustass Kid's right-hand man), a member of the Tobi Roppo, or appear at Big Mom's Tea Party or Wano.
supportingEvidence: Gin's sacrifice in Episode 28 showed his capacity for survival and honor
The MH5 poison was described as deadly but Gin was receiving medical care
Gin promised to meet Luffy again someday in the Grand Line
resolution: CONFIRMED - In manga chapter 1117 (2024), Gin, Don Krieg, and Pearl are shown alive on Pirate Island (Hachinosu) in the New World, confirming Gin survived and the Krieg Pirates made it to the Grand Line.

theoryTitle: Gin as Krieg Pirates' New Captain
theoryText: After Gin's return was confirmed in chapter 1117, fans began theorizing about the current power structure of the Krieg Pirates. Some fans speculate that Gin may have become the captain of the crew, with Don Krieg and Pearl serving under him. This would represent a complete reversal from the Baratie Arc where Gin was Krieg's subordinate who suffered from his captain's cruelty.
supportingEvidence: Gin demonstrated superior honor and morality compared to Krieg in Episode 28
Gin's sacrifice showed leadership qualities that Krieg lacked
The crew's survival suggests someone more competent than Krieg may have led them through the New World
resolution: UNCONFIRMED - Current manga/anime has not revealed the internal power structure of the Krieg Pirates

theoryText: Since the Krieg Pirates were confirmed to be on Hachinosu (Pirate Island), which is ruled by Blackbeard, fans theorize that they may have joined forces with the Blackbeard Pirates. This would explain how a relatively weak crew from the East Blue survived in the New World.
supportingEvidence: The Krieg Pirates are located on Blackbeard's territory
Blackbeard is known to recruit powerful pirates and crews
The Krieg Pirates' arsenal-based fighting style could complement Blackbeard's crew
resolution: UNCONFIRMED - No official confirmation of alliance or subordination

theoryText: Fans have long theorized that Gin and Sanji will meet again, allowing Gin to repay the kindness Sanji showed him. With Gin's survival confirmed, this reunion could happen in the New World. Some fans believe this meeting could lead to Gin joining Luffy's Grand Fleet or becoming an ally against a common enemy.
supportingEvidence: Gin promised to meet again in the Grand Line
Gin's character arc in the Baratie showed profound gratitude to Sanji
Sanji's kindness to Gin was a defining moment for both characters
Gin is now confirmed alive in the New World where the Straw Hats currently are
resolution: UNCONFIRMED - No reunion has occurred yet in manga or anime

theoryTitle: The MH5 Poison's Lasting Effects on Gin
theoryText: Some fans theorize that while Gin survived the MH5 poisoning, it may have had lasting effects on his body. These effects could include chronic illness, reduced physical abilities, or the need for ongoing medical treatment. Alternatively, some speculate that overcoming the poison may have made him stronger or more resistant to toxins.
supportingEvidence: The MH5 gas was described as causing immediate organ failure and internal bleeding
Gin's survival of such a deadly poison suggests either exceptional medical care or physical resilience
In One Piece, surviving near-death experiences often leads to character development or power growth
resolution: UNCONFIRMED - Gin's current physical condition has not been detailed in the manga/anime
